Reading Workshop is my favourite part of the day. There is nothing like supporting young readers as they grow and build skills!

Loved this feedback today, "Ms. Gelson when you teached us how to put the long words into small parts, it helped me so much. I love reading!" Word detectives take it apart & put it back together #decodingwork
Chloe and the Lion is one of my favourites! Many students love it for the same reasons! @macbarnett @MrAdamRex https://t.co/YFrO839CLZ
This hilarious book by @AmeDyckman inspired one writer in our room to write her own retelling! She is busy adding illustrations https://t.co/hFlWvnSZuu

@judith_hardman @ashleyspires Such fun! Elwood is very popular in my room
So loved reading this! https://t.co/kPSQTQQAkq

This book. @SuzanneDelRizzo, your book inspired this writing: "I am trying to forget my country but I can't. If the war stops, I will say goodbye to everyone and have a picture with them and go. I always dream of my country. You don't know how I love my country." https://t.co/TQx8JbxSZ4

We read books like The Journey by @Frenci_San so they have the chance to ask questions like this:" I wonder what it feels like for something beautiful to be destroyed?" #grade3wonder #readyourworld https://t.co/xJwGS0wbAl
We read Lost and Found Cat and then reread it together and watched a video about Kunkush and his family put out by the Guardian What a story! https://t.co/iuPiQNTOmX
